translated: one will know the concise and extensive teachings of all phenomena.‚Äù

original: chos kyi dbyings shes na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po chos thams cad kyi mdo dang rgyas pa shes par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni chos kyi dbyings don dam pa dang kun rdzob kyi tshul du shes na chos thams cad chos kyi dbyings kyi nang
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings shes na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po chos thams cad kyi mdo dang rgyas pa shes par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni chos kyi dbyings don dam pa dang kun rdzob kyi tshul du shes na chos thams cad chos kyi dbyings kyi nang
translated: This is to say, if one knows the Element of attributes in the manner of the ultimate and the conventional, one will know the brief and extensive of all dharmas.

original: du 'dus pas don dam pa'i tshul du shes pas ni mdor shes so //
analyzed: du 'dus pas don dam pa'i tshul du shes pas ni mdor shes so //
translated: By knowing in the manner of the ultimate, one will know the brief.

original: kun rdzob kyi tshul du shes par 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: kun rdzob kyi tshul du shes par 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: By knowing in the manner of the conventional, one will know the extensive.üîΩThis is the teaching.üîΩHe asks, ‚ÄúBhagavan, what is the Element of attributes?‚Äù

original: gsol pa bcom ldan 'das chos kyi dbyings gang lags zhes bya ba ni theg pa chung ngu'i gzhung ltar na rdzas bdun pa yang chos kyi dbyings zhes bya /
analyzed: gsol pa bcom ldan 'das chos kyi dbyings gang lags zhes bya ba ni theg pa chung ngu'i gzhung ltar na rdzas bdun pa yang chos kyi dbyings zhes bya /
translated: According to the scriptures of the Hinayana, the seven substances are called the Element of attributes.

original: chos rnams skye zhing 'byung ba'i rgyu'am gnas la yang dbyings zhes bya /
analyzed: chos rnams skye zhing 'byung ba'i rgyu'am gnas la yang dbyings zhes bya /
translated: The cause or basis of the arising and occurrence of dharmas is also called the Element.

original: rang gi mtshan nyid 'dzin pa la yang dbyings zhes bya /
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid 'dzin pa la yang dbyings zhes bya /
translated: The holding of their individual characteristics is also called the Element.

original: skabs 'dir chos kyi @238a * //
analyzed: skabs 'dir chos kyi @238a * //
translated: In this context, the Element of attributes is the ultimate truth.

original: dbyings zhes bya ba gang la bya zhes zhus pa'o //
analyzed: dbyings zhes bya ba gang la bya zhes zhus pa'o //
translated: What is meant by the term element?

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Bhagavat replied:üîΩThe non-element is the dharma-element.

original: dbyings med pa ni chos kyi dbyings te zhes bya ba ni theg pa chung ngu'i gzhung las byung ba'i chos kyi dbyings gong du smos pa rnam pa gsum la sogs pa'i dngos po med pa la chos kyi dbyings zhes bya'o zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: dbyings med pa ni chos kyi dbyings te zhes bya ba ni theg pa chung ngu'i gzhung las byung ba'i chos kyi dbyings gong du smos pa rnam pa gsum la sogs pa'i dngos po med pa la chos kyi dbyings zhes bya'o zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: This teaches that the non-existence of the three kinds of things mentioned above, which occur in the scriptures of the Lesser Vehicle, is called the dharma-element.üîΩThe dharma-element is not perceived as either interrupted or continuous.

original: chos kyi dbyings de la chad pa dang yongs su chad pa mi dmigs so zhes bya ba ni chos kyi dbyings de mi 'gyur ba yongs su grub pa'i phyir chad pa dang gzhan du 'gyur ba med do zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings de la chad pa dang yongs su chad pa mi dmigs so zhes bya ba ni chos kyi dbyings de mi 'gyur ba yongs su grub pa'i phyir chad pa dang gzhan du 'gyur ba med do zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: This teaches that the dharma-element is not interrupted and does not change into something else, because it is unchanging and fully accomplished.üîΩThe bodhisattva-mahƒÅsattva who knows the dharma-element in this way will know the concise and extensive teachings of all dharmas.

original: chos kyi dbyings de ltar shes pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni chos thams cad kyi mdo dang rgyas pa shes par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni gong du bstan pa'i don mjug bsdus nas bstan pa ste /
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings de ltar shes pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni chos thams cad kyi mdo dang rgyas pa shes par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni gong du bstan pa'i don mjug bsdus nas bstan pa ste /

original: de ltar gong du smos pa'i tshul du don dam par chos thams cad chos kyi dbyings su ro gcig par shes na chos thams cad kyi mdo shes so //
analyzed: de ltar gong du smos pa'i tshul du don dam par chos thams cad chos kyi dbyings su ro gcig par shes na chos thams cad kyi mdo shes so //
translated: Thus, if one knows that all phenomena are of one taste in the ultimate expanse, as explained above, one knows the summary of all phenomena.

original: kun rdzob tu chos de la ma chags par bya ste /
analyzed: kun rdzob tu chos de la ma chags par bya ste /
translated: One should not be attached to those phenomena on the conventional level.

original: chos thams cad kyi so so'i mtshan nyid shes pa ni rgyas par shes pa'o zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: chos thams cad kyi so so'i mtshan nyid shes pa ni rgyas par shes pa'o zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: Knowing the individual characteristics of all phenomena is taught to be the extensive explanation.

original: gsol pa bcom ldan 'das ji ltar chos thams cad kyi mdo dang rgyas pa 'tshal bar bgyi zhes bya ba ni chos thams cad kyi mdo dang rgyas par shes pa gong du mdor bshad pas tshim par ma gyur pa'i sems can rnams la phan gdags pa'i phyir zhus
analyzed: gsol pa bcom ldan 'das ji ltar chos thams cad kyi mdo dang rgyas pa 'tshal bar bgyi zhes bya ba ni chos thams cad kyi mdo dang rgyas par shes pa gong du mdor bshad pas tshim par ma gyur pa'i sems can rnams la phan gdags pa'i phyir zhus
translated: He said, ‚ÄúBlessed One, how should one know the summary and extensive explanation of all phenomena?‚Äù This is a request made in order to benefit those beings who are not satisfied with the brief explanation of knowing the summary and extensive explanation of all phenomena given above.

original: pa'o // bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: pa'o // bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One replied,

original: ci nas kyang chos thams cad ldan pa yang ma yin /
analyzed: ci nas kyang chos thams cad ldan pa yang ma yin /
translated: ‚ÄúOne should know that all phenomena are neither conjoined nor disjoined,

analyzed: mi ldan pa yang ma yin par shes par bya'o zhes bya ba ni chos thams cad dngos po zhig yod na ni phan tshun ldan par 'gyur na /
translated: If things existed, they would be conjoined with each other.

original: chos thams cad rang bzhin gyis stong zhing dngos po med pas gang dang yang ldan par 'gyur ba de lta bu med de de bas chos thams cad ldan pa yang ma yin mi ldan pa yang ma yin par shes par bya'o zhes bstan pa'o //üîΩgsol pa bcom ldan 'das ldan pa yang ma lags /
analyzed: chos thams cad rang bzhin gyis stong zhing dngos po med pas gang dang yang ldan par 'gyur ba de lta bu med de de bas chos thams cad ldan pa yang ma yin mi ldan pa yang ma yin par shes par bya'o zhes bstan pa'o // gsol pa bcom ldan 'das ldan pa yang ma lags /
translated: But since all things are empty of essence and do not exist, there is no such thing as their being conjoined with anything. Therefore, one should understand that all things are neither conjoined nor disjoined.

original: mi ldan pa yang ma lags pa'i chos de dag kyang gang lags zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: mi ldan pa yang ma lags pa'i chos de dag kyang gang lags zhes bya ba ni /
translated: ≈öƒÅriputra asks, ‚ÄúBlessed One, what are those things that are neither conjoined nor disjoined?‚Äù

original: gong du chos thams cad ces spyir smos pa ming gis re re nas smos te zhib tu bshad pa'i phyir zhus pa'o //üîΩbcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: gong du chos thams cad ces spyir smos pa ming gis re re nas smos te zhib tu bshad pa'i phyir zhus pa'o // bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: He asks this in order to explain in detail, by mentioning them one by one, the things that were mentioned in general above with the words ‚Äúall things.‚Äù

original: gzugs ldan pa yang ma yin mi ldan pa yang ma @238b yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pas /
analyzed: gzugs ldan pa yang ma yin mi ldan pa yang ma @238b yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pas /
translated: The Blessed One replies, ‚Äú≈öƒÅriputra, form is neither conjoined nor disjoined.‚Äù

original: gzugs la sogs pa rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la thug gi bar gyi chos thams cad dngos po med pas /
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la thug gi bar gyi chos thams cad dngos po med pas /
translated: Since all phenomena, from form up to omniscience, are non-entities,

original: gang dang yang ldan pa'am mi ldan pa ma yin no zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: gang dang yang ldan pa'am mi ldan pa ma yin no zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: they are neither associated nor non-associated with anything.

original: 'dus byas kyi khams ldan pa yang ma yin mi ldan pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: 'dus byas kyi khams ldan pa yang ma yin mi ldan pa yang ma yin no //
translated: The conditioned element is neither associated nor non-associated.

original: 'dus ma byas kyi khams ldan pa yang ma yin mi ldan pa yang ma yin no zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: 'dus ma byas kyi khams ldan pa yang ma yin mi ldan pa yang ma yin no zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The unconditioned element is neither associated nor non-associated.

original: gong du gzugs la sogs pa rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la thug gi bar gyi chos rnams thams cad re re nas smos te /
analyzed: gong du gzugs la sogs pa rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la thug gi bar gyi chos rnams thams cad re re nas smos te /
translated: The above explains each of the phenomena from form up to omniscience in detail.

original: rgyas par bshad pa'i don de nyid mdor bsdus pa'am dga' ba'i sems can rnams la phan gdags pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rgyas par bshad pa'i don de nyid mdor bsdus pa'am dga' ba'i sems can rnams la phan gdags pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to summarize the meaning of that extensive explanation, or to benefit those with joyful minds,

original: 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas kyi khams mdor bsdus te bstan pa'o //
analyzed: 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas kyi khams mdor bsdus te bstan pa'o //
translated: the conditioned and unconditioned elements are taught in brief.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: gang ldan pa'am mi ldan par 'gyur ba de lta bu'i ngo bo nyid med de zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni gong du bshad pa'i gtan tshigs bstan pa ste /
analyzed: gang ldan pa'am mi ldan par 'gyur ba de lta bu'i ngo bo nyid med de zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni gong du bshad pa'i gtan tshigs bstan pa ste /
translated: The statement ‚Äúthere is no such intrinsic reality that would be possessed or not possessed‚Äù and so on teaches the reason explained above.

original: dngos po 'ga' zhig yod na ldan pa'am mi ldan pa zhes byar rung na don dam par chos thams cad rang bzhin gyis stong ste /
analyzed: dngos po 'ga' zhig yod na ldan pa'am mi ldan pa zhes byar rung na don dam par chos thams cad rang bzhin gyis stong ste /
translated: If some thing existed, it would be suitable to say it is possessed or not possessed. But ultimately all phenomena are empty of intrinsic reality.

original: dngos po med pas ldan pa'am mi ldan par 'gyur ba gang yang med do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: dngos po med pas ldan pa'am mi ldan par 'gyur ba gang yang med do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Since they are not things, there is nothing at all that is possessed or not possessed. This is the meaning.

original: rab 'byor 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mdor bsdus pa ste zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: rab 'byor 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mdor bsdus pa ste zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Subh≈´ti, this is the concise perfection of wisdom of bodhisattva great beings.

original: gong du bshad pa'i tshul du chos thams cad rang bzhin gyis stong ste dngos po med pas ldan pa ma yin /
analyzed: gong du bshad pa'i tshul du chos thams cad rang bzhin gyis stong ste dngos po med pas ldan pa ma yin /
translated: As explained above, since all phenomena are empty of intrinsic reality and are not things, they are not possessed.

original: mi ldan pa yang ma yin par bshad pa de nyid chos thams cad stong pa nyid du ro gcig par mdor bsdus te bstan pa ste /
analyzed: mi ldan pa yang ma yin par bshad pa de nyid chos thams cad stong pa nyid du ro gcig par mdor bsdus te bstan pa ste /
translated: This very explanation of the absence of both existence and non-existence is the brief teaching of the one taste of all phenomena in emptiness.

original: 'di nyid shes bya dang nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa thams cad bsal ba'i mthar phyin cing /
analyzed: 'di nyid shes bya dang nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa thams cad bsal ba'i mthar phyin cing /
translated: This very [emptiness] is the perfection of the elimination of all the obscurations of knowables and afflictions,

original: don thams cad kyi pha rol tu phyin te yongs su rdzogs pas na pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: don thams cad kyi pha rol tu phyin te yongs su rdzogs pas na pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya'o //
translated: and it is the perfection of the completion of all goals. Therefore, it is called the perfection.

original: mdor bsdus pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa 'di la las dang po pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos bslab par bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: mdor bsdus pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa 'di la las dang po pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos bslab par bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The beginner bodhisattva mahƒÅsattva should train in this brief perfection.

original: stong pa nyid du mdor bsdus te bstan pa'i don 'di la mos pa spyod pa'i sa la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis kyang mos pa yid la byed pas bslab par bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: stong pa nyid du mdor bsdus te bstan pa'i don 'di la mos pa spyod pa'i sa la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis kyang mos pa yid la byed pas bslab par bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: This means that the bodhisattvas abiding on the stage of devoted conduct should also train with the mental engagement of devotion in this meaning taught as the brief summary of emptiness.

original: las dang po pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: las dang po pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: As for beginner,

analyzed: mos pa spyod pa'i sa la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' la bya'o //
translated: It is to be understood as referring to the Bodhisattva who is on the stage of action in faith.

original: byang chub @239a * //
analyzed: byang chub @239a * //
translated: Enlightenment

original: chub sems dpa'i sa bcu la gnas te /
analyzed: chub sems dpa'i sa bcu la gnas te /
translated: is to be understood as referring to the ten Bodhisattva stages.

original: mdor bsdus pa la bslab par bya'o zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa'i sa dang po nas sa bcu'i par du gnas pas kyang mdor bsdus pa'i don 'di nyid la de kho na nyid rtogs pa'i tshul gyis bslab par bya'o zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: mdor bsdus pa la bslab par bya'o zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa'i sa dang po nas sa bcu'i par du gnas pas kyang mdor bsdus pa'i don 'di nyid la de kho na nyid rtogs pa'i tshul gyis bslab par bya'o zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: The meaning of the summary should be studied. This shows that the Bodhisattva who is on the first stage up to the tenth stage should study just this meaning of the summary by way of realizing reality.

original: mdor bsdus pa'i don 'di la slob pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni chos thams cad kyi mdo dang rgyas pa shes par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: mdor bsdus pa'i don 'di la slob pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni chos thams cad kyi mdo dang rgyas pa shes par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The Bodhisattva-mahƒÅsattva who studies this meaning of the summary will know the concise and extensive teachings of all dharmas.

original: gong du bstan pa'i don de lta bu la slob pa'i phan yon bstan pa'o //
analyzed: gong du bstan pa'i don de lta bu la slob pa'i phan yon bstan pa'o //
translated: This shows the benefit of studying the meaning that was taught above.

original: gsol pa bcom ldan 'das 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po dbang po rnon pos rtogs pa'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: gsol pa bcom ldan 'das 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po dbang po rnon pos rtogs pa'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: He said, Blessed One, this is to be understood by the Bodhisattva-mahƒÅsattva of sharp faculties.

original: 'khor gyi nang na sems can dbang po rno rtul du ma zhig yod pas de dag gi nang na dbang po rtul po kha cig 'di lta bu'i don zab mo bdag cag gi spyod yul du mi 'gyur ro snyam nas sgyid lugs pa'i sems skye ba dag bsal
analyzed: 'khor gyi nang na sems can dbang po rno rtul du ma zhig yod pas de dag gi nang na dbang po rtul po kha cig 'di lta bu'i don zab mo bdag cag gi spyod yul du mi 'gyur ro snyam nas sgyid lugs pa'i sems skye ba dag bsal
translated: Since there are many sentient beings with sharp and dull faculties in the retinue, some of the dull-facultied ones might think, Such a profound meaning will not become the domain of our experience, and give rise to a discouraged mind.

original: ba'i phyir de skad zhus so //
analyzed: ba'i phyir de skad zhus so //
translated: Therefore, this was asked in order to dispel that.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,üîΩSubh≈´ti, this is realized by the bodhisattva mahƒÅsattvas who are attached to the faculties.

original: rab 'byor 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po dbang po zhen pas kyang rtogs par 'gyur ba'o zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni mdor bsdus pa'i don zab mo 'di dbang po rno rtul kun gyi spyod yul du 'gyur te dad pa che zhing brtson
analyzed: rab 'byor 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po dbang po zhen pas kyang rtogs par 'gyur ba'o zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni mdor bsdus pa'i don zab mo 'di dbang po rno rtul kun gyi spyod yul du 'gyur te dad pa che zhing brtson
translated: In brief, this profound meaning becomes the domain of experience of all those with sharp and dull faculties.

original: 'grus spyad de slob par 'dod pa kun gyis kyang lobs shing rtogs par 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'grus spyad de slob par 'dod pa kun gyis kyang lobs shing rtogs par 'gyur te /
translated: Even all those who have great faith, who practice with diligence, and who desire to learn will master and realize it.

analyzed: gang gis kyang rtogs par mi 'gyur ba med kyi /
translated: There is nothing that will not be realized by anyone.

original: le lo can dang brtson 'grus zhan pa dang / dran pa nyams pa dang / sems 'khrugs pa 'ba' zhig gis rtogs par mi 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa ste /
analyzed: le lo can dang brtson 'grus zhan pa dang / dran pa nyams pa dang / sems 'khrugs pa 'ba' zhig gis rtogs par mi 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa ste /
translated: It is taught that it is not realized by those who are lazy, who have little perseverance, who have impaired mindfulness, or whose minds are disturbed.

analyzed: de la le lo can ni dge ba ma yin pa'i chos gzhan la zhen pa'o //
translated: Among them, those who are lazy are those who are attached to other, non-virtuous dharmas.

analyzed: brtson 'grus zhan pa ni dge ba la sems mi spro ba'o // phyir mi ldog pa'i sa la slob par 'dod pa rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par 'dod pas rtogs par 'gyur te zhes bya ba ni gong du slob par 'dod pas rtogs par 'gyur ro zhes spyir bshad pa gang la slob par 'dod pa'i dmigs phye
translated: Those who have little perseverance are those whose minds do not delight in virtue.üîΩThose who wish to train on the irreversible ground, who wish to attain omniscience, will realize it.

original: ste zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: ste zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: This is a specific explanation of the general statement above that ‚Äúthose who wish to train will realize it.‚Äù

analyzed: gal te ji skad du bstan pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la slob cing zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni gong du ji skad bstan pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la slob cing pha rol tu phyin pa drug yongs su rdzogs par byas nas /
translated: If one trains in the perfection of wisdom as it has been taught, and so on, then one trains in the perfection of wisdom as it has been taught above, and having perfected the six perfections,

original: rnam pa @239b thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par byed na /
analyzed: rnam pa @239b thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par byed na /
translated: one will attain the knowledge of all aspects.

original: bdud kyis mi tshugs pa dang / sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyis dgongs shing byin gyis brlabs par 'gyur ba'i phan yon bstan pa'o //
analyzed: bdud kyis mi tshugs pa dang / sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyis dgongs shing byin gyis brlabs par 'gyur ba'i phan yon bstan pa'o //
translated: This teaches the benefit of not being harmed by demons and of being contemplated and blessed by the Blessed Buddhas.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is like this:üîΩThe Blessed Buddhas of the past, future, and present arise from these six perfections.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa drug po 'di dag las byung ba ni 'das pa dang ma byon pa dang da ltar byung ba'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams te zhes bya bas ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams dgongs shing byin gyis rlob par 'gyur ba'i gtan tshigs

original: de'i gtan tshigs kyang bsod nams bya ba'i dngos po rnams dang / zag pa med pa'i phung po lnga dang / rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu la sogs pa ston pa'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di las byung na /

analyzed: 'dus ma byas la mkhas pa ni /
translated: Skill in the unconditioned is

translated: skill in suchness and so forth, which are not created by the assembly of causes and conditions.

original: khams la mkhas pa ni /
analyzed: khams la mkhas pa ni /
translated: Skill in the realms is

original: khams gsum la mkhas pa'o //
analyzed: khams gsum la mkhas pa'o //
translated: skill in the three realms.

original: khams med pa la mkhas pa ni /
analyzed: khams med pa la mkhas pa ni /
translated: Skill in the absence of realms is

original: don dam par khams gsum dngos po med par mkhas pa'o //
analyzed: don dam par khams gsum dngos po med par mkhas pa'o //
translated: skill in the ultimate non-entityness of the three realms.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni gzugs @241b yid la mi byed pa la mkhas par rig par bya'o zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni gzugs la sogs pa rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la thug gi bar du chos thams cad don dam par
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni gzugs @241b yid la mi byed pa la mkhas par rig par bya'o zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni gzugs la sogs pa rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la thug gi bar du chos thams cad don dam par
translated: This and the rest teaches that since all phenomena, from form up to omniscience, are ultimately

original: dngos po med pas /
analyzed: dngos po med pas /
translated: nonexistent,

original: gang yang yid la bya ba'i yul ma yin par rtogs nas /
analyzed: gang yang yid la bya ba'i yul ma yin par rtogs nas /
translated: having realized that they are not objects of mental activity at all,

original: chos de dag gang yang yid la mi byed pa la mkhas par 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: chos de dag gang yang yid la mi byed pa la mkhas par 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: one becomes skilled in not attending to any of those phenomena at all.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de ni gzugs gzugs kyis stong ngo zhes bya ba la mkhas par rig par bya'o zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de ni gzugs gzugs kyis stong ngo zhes bya ba la mkhas par rig par bya'o zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni /
translated: The bodhisattva mahƒÅsattva should be known as skilled in the fact that form is empty of form.

original: gzugs la sogs pa rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la thug gi bar gyi chos de rnams don dam par dngos po med pas so so'i rang bzhin gyis stong par shes par 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la thug gi bar gyi chos de rnams don dam par dngos po med pas so so'i rang bzhin gyis stong par shes par 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: This and the rest teaches that since those phenomena, from form up to omniscience, are ultimately nonexistent, one will understand that they are empty of their own intrinsic nature.

original: rab tu sbyangs pa'i lam la mkhas pa zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten pa'i lam gyis lus dang sems las su rung ba'i mtshan nyid rab tu sbyangs pa zhes bya ba bde ba can la mkhas pa'o ;
analyzed: rab tu sbyangs pa'i lam la mkhas pa zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten pa'i lam gyis lus dang sems las su rung ba'i mtshan nyid rab tu sbyangs pa zhes bya ba bde ba can la mkhas pa'o ;
translated: Skill in the path of thorough purification refers to skill in the bliss of thorough purification, which is the characteristic of physical and mental flexibility through the mundane path.

original: / rab tu ma sbyangs pa la mkhas pa zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lam gyis lus dang sems las su rung bar bya ste rab tu ma sbyangs pa'i bde ba la ma chags pa la mkhas pa'o //
analyzed: / rab tu ma sbyangs pa la mkhas pa zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lam gyis lus dang sems las su rung bar bya ste rab tu ma sbyangs pa'i bde ba la ma chags pa la mkhas pa'o //
translated: Skill in the lack of thorough purification refers to skill in the bliss of the lack of thorough purification, which is the lack of attachment to physical and mental flexibility through the supramundane path.

original: skye ba dang 'gag pa la mkhas pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni skye ba dang 'gag pa dang / gnas pa las gzhan du 'gyur ba'i rang bzhin la mkhas shing /
analyzed: skye ba dang 'gag pa la mkhas pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni skye ba dang 'gag pa dang / gnas pa las gzhan du 'gyur ba'i rang bzhin la mkhas shing /
translated: Skill in origination and cessation and so on refers to skill in the nature of origination, cessation, endurance and change.

original: 'dod chags dang zhe sdang dang gti mug dang / de rnams med pa'i rang bzhin la mkhas pa dang / mu stegs can gyi lta ba rnams kyi rgyus dang lta ba de dag med pa la mkhas pa dang / ming dang gzugs la sogs pa'i chos rnams kyi rang bzhin dang /
analyzed: 'dod chags dang zhe sdang dang gti mug dang / de rnams med pa'i rang bzhin la mkhas pa dang / mu stegs can gyi lta ba rnams kyi rgyus dang lta ba de dag med pa la mkhas pa dang / ming dang gzugs la sogs pa'i chos rnams kyi rang bzhin dang /
translated: Skill in the nature of desire, hatred, and confusion, and their absence; skill in the causes of the views of the tƒ´rthikas and the absence of those views; skill in the nature, cause, and effect of phenomena such as name and form;

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu la mkhas par 'gyur ba la sogs pa'i phan yon bstan pa'o //
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu la mkhas par 'gyur ba la sogs pa'i phan yon bstan pa'o //
translated: and so forth.

original: gsol pa bcom ldan 'das ji ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyad par bgyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni gong du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyad pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mngon par bsgrub pa dang /
analyzed: gsol pa bcom ldan 'das ji ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyad par bgyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni gong du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyad pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mngon par bsgrub pa dang /
translated: He said, ‚ÄúBlessed One, how should one practice the perfection of wisdom?‚Äù and so forth. It is said that in the practice of the perfection of wisdom, in the accomplishment of the perfection of wisdom,

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsgom pa de la legs pa 'di dag yod par rig par bya'o zhes gsungs pa la /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsgom pa de la legs pa 'di dag yod par rig par bya'o zhes gsungs pa la /
translated: and in the cultivation of the perfection of wisdom, these good qualities are to be known.

original: spyad pa dang mngon par bsgrub pa dang bsgom pa gsum gyi bye brag zhus pa'o //
analyzed: spyad pa dang mngon par bsgrub pa dang bsgom pa gsum gyi bye brag zhus pa'o //
translated: The distinctions of the three, practice, clear realization, and meditation, are asked about.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Lord replied:

original: gzugs zhi ba dang zhes bya ba la @242a * //
analyzed: gzugs zhi ba dang zhes bya ba la @242a * //
translated: The five aggregates should be understood as peaceful, insubstantial, hollow, and worthless, beginning with form.

original: sogs pas de dag gi bye brag bstan pa ste /
analyzed: sogs pas de dag gi bye brag bstan pa ste /
translated: The distinctions of those are taught, beginning with peaceful.

original: gzugs la sogs pa'i phung po lnga rnams zhi ba dang / rag las pa dang / gsob dang snying po med par rtogs par bya ste /
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa'i phung po lnga rnams zhi ba dang / rag las pa dang / gsob dang snying po med par rtogs par bya ste /
translated: The five aggregates of form, etc., should be understood as peaceful, insubstantial, hollow, and worthless.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyad par bya'o zhes bstan pa ste /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyad par bya'o zhes bstan pa ste /
translated: One should practice the perfection of wisdom.

original: de la zhi ba ni don dam pa'i rang bzhin gyis stong pas skye ba dang 'jig pa la sogs pa med pa'o //
analyzed: de la zhi ba ni don dam pa'i rang bzhin gyis stong pas skye ba dang 'jig pa la sogs pa med pa'o //
translated: Therein, peaceful means that, being empty of ultimate nature, there is no origination, cessation, etc.üîΩHollow means that, being empty of conventional nature, there is no origination, cessation, etc.üîΩWorthless means that, being empty of both natures, there is no origination, cessation, etc.

original: rag las pa ni dngos po yod par gzhung mi tshugs pa'o //üîΩgsob dang snying po med pa ni dngos po med pa'i rnam grangs so //
analyzed: rag las pa ni dngos po yod par gzhung mi tshugs pa'o //üîΩgsob dang snying po med pa ni dngos po med pa'i rnam grangs so //
translated: Insubstantial is a synonym for worthless.

original: nam mkha' stong pa nyid mngon par bsgrubs pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mngon par bsgrub par bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: nam mkha' stong pa nyid mngon par bsgrubs pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mngon par bsgrub par bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The perfection of wisdom should be accomplished by accomplishing the emptiness of space.

original: mngon par bsgrub pa bstan pa ste /
analyzed: mngon par bsgrub pa bstan pa ste /
translated: This is the teaching on accomplishment.

original: chos thams cad nam mkha' ltar stong pa nyid du rtogs par byas nas /
analyzed: chos thams cad nam mkha' ltar stong pa nyid du rtogs par byas nas /
translated: Having realized all phenomena as empty like space,

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa rtogs par bya'o zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa rtogs par bya'o zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: the perfection of wisdom should be realized.

original: bsgom pa rnam par bsgoms pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsgom par bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: bsgom pa rnam par bsgoms pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsgom par bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The perfection of wisdom should be cultivated by cultivating the cultivation.

original: bsgom pa nyid kyang stong pa nyid du bshig ste /
analyzed: bsgom pa nyid kyang stong pa nyid du bshig ste /
translated: Having destroyed even the cultivation itself as empty,

original: med par bsgoms pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsgom par bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: med par bsgoms pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsgom par bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: cultivating it as nonexistent, the perfection of wisdom should be cultivated. This is the meaning.

original: dang po'i spyod pa ni mos pa spyod pa'i sa nas sa dang po'i bar du rtsol ba dang bcas shing mtshan ma dang bcas pa'i gnas skabs la bya'o //
analyzed: dang po'i spyod pa ni mos pa spyod pa'i sa nas sa dang po'i bar du rtsol ba dang bcas shing mtshan ma dang bcas pa'i gnas skabs la bya'o //
translated: The first practice refers to the stage of devoted conduct up to the first ground, the stage with effort and with signs.

original: de'i 'og tu mngon par bsgrub pa ni sa dang po yan chad sa bdun gyi bar du rtsol pa dang bcas la mtshan ma med pa'i gnas skabs la bya'o //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu mngon par bsgrub pa ni sa dang po yan chad sa bdun gyi bar du rtsol pa dang bcas la mtshan ma med pa'i gnas skabs la bya'o //
translated: Then, after that, the accomplishment is the period of the signless, with effort, from the first stage up to the seventh stage.

original: de'i yang 'og tu bsgom pa ni sa brgyad pa yan chad lhun gyis grub cing mtshan ma med pa la gnas pa'i gnas skabs la bya'o //üîΩgsol pa bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la yun ring po ji srid du spyad na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyad par 'gyur zhes bya ba ni don de nyid gsal bar
analyzed: de'i yang 'og tu bsgom pa ni sa brgyad pa yan chad lhun gyis grub cing mtshan ma med pa la gnas pa'i gnas skabs la bya'o // gsol pa bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la yun ring po ji srid du spyad na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyad par 'gyur zhes bya ba ni don de nyid gsal bar
translated: Then, after that, the cultivation is the period of the signless, spontaneously accomplished, from the eighth stage on up.

original: bshad pa'i phyir zhus pa'o //
analyzed: bshad pa'i phyir zhus pa'o //
translated: He asks, Blessed One, for how long a time should a bodhisattva mahƒÅsattva practice the perfection of wisdom in order to practice the perfection of wisdom? This is a request for clarification of that very meaning.

original: sems dang po bskyed pa nas nye bar bzung ste snying po byang chub la 'dug gi bar du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyad par bya ba yin te zhes bya ba ni dang po mos pa spyod pa'i sa la sems dang po bskyed paüîΩnas bzung ste /
analyzed: sems dang po bskyed pa nas nye bar bzung ste snying po byang chub la 'dug gi bar du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyad par bya ba yin te zhes bya ba ni dang po mos pa spyod pa'i sa la sems dang po bskyed pa nas bzung ste /
translated: This is the first stage of the one practicing for the first time, the stage of devoted interest.

original: sa dang po'i bar du rtsol ba dang bcas shing mtshan ma dang bcas par spyad /
analyzed: sa dang po'i bar du rtsol ba dang bcas shing mtshan ma dang bcas par spyad /
translated: From there up to the first stage, one practices with effort and with signs.

original: de'i 'og tu sa dang po nas sa bdun pa la thug gi bar du rtsol ba dang bcas shing @242b mtshan ma med par mngon par bsgrub /üîΩde'i yang 'og tu sa brgyad pa nas sangs rgyas kyi sa'i bar du rtsol ba yang med /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu sa dang po nas sa bdun pa la thug gi bar du rtsol ba dang bcas shing @242b mtshan ma med par mngon par bsgrub / de'i yang 'og tu sa brgyad pa nas sangs rgyas kyi sa'i bar du rtsol ba yang med /
translated: After that, from the first stage up to the seventh stage, one accomplishes with effort and without signs.üîΩAfter that, from the eighth stage up to the stage of buddha, one should meditate without effort and without signs, spontaneously.

original: mtshan ma yang med par lhun gyis grub pa nyid du bsgom dgos so zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: mtshan ma yang med par lhun gyis grub pa nyid du bsgom dgos so zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: This is what is taught.

original: gsol pa bcom ldan 'das ji ltar sems kyi rgyun ma chad pa dang bral bar spyad par bgyi zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: gsol pa bcom ldan 'das ji ltar sems kyi rgyun ma chad pa dang bral bar spyad par bgyi zhes bya ba ni /
translated: He asks, ‚ÄúBlessed One, how should one practice without separating from the uninterrupted stream of mind?‚Äù

original: de ltar sems dang po bskyed pa nas snying po byang chub la 'dug gi bar du spyad pa dang / mngon par bsgrub pa dang / bsgom par bgyi na sems la bar chad ma mchis par ji ltar bgyi zhes zhus pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar sems dang po bskyed pa nas snying po byang chub la 'dug gi bar du spyad pa dang / mngon par bsgrub pa dang / bsgom par bgyi na sems la bar chad ma mchis par ji ltar bgyi zhes zhus pa'o //
translated: Thus, from the first production of the thought up to sitting on the site of awakening, one should practice, should accomplish, should cultivate‚Äîbut how should one do it without interruption of thought?

original: yid la bya ba gzhan gyi go skabs mi 'byed pas zhes bya ba ni rnam pa thams can mkhyen pa nyid ma yin pa'i yid la bya ba gzhan rnams kyi go skabs mi dbye bas spyad par bya'o zhes bstan pa ste /
analyzed: yid la bya ba gzhan gyi go skabs mi 'byed pas zhes bya ba ni rnam pa thams can mkhyen pa nyid ma yin pa'i yid la bya ba gzhan rnams kyi go skabs mi dbye bas spyad par bya'o zhes bstan pa ste /
translated: ‚ÄúWithout admitting any other mental activity‚Äù means that one should practice without admitting any other mental activity that is not the knowledge of all aspects.

original: don de nyid gsal bar bstan pa'i phyir rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid yid la bya ba mi 'dor bas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyad par bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: don de nyid gsal bar bstan pa'i phyir rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid yid la bya ba mi 'dor bas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyad par bya ba gsungs so //
translated: In order to clearly demonstrate just that meaning, he says, ‚ÄúOne should practice the perfection of wisdom by not abandoning the mental activity of the knowledge of all aspects.‚Äù

original: ci nas kyang sems dang sems las byung ba'i chos mi rgyu ba de ltar spyad par bya'o zhes bya ba ni de ltar yid la bya ba gzhan gyi skabs mi dbye bas spyad par bya ba'i thabs bstan pa ste /
analyzed: ci nas kyang sems dang sems las byung ba'i chos mi rgyu ba de ltar spyad par bya'o zhes bya ba ni de ltar yid la bya ba gzhan gyi skabs mi dbye bas spyad par bya ba'i thabs bstan pa ste /
translated: ‚ÄúOne should practice in such a way that the mind and mental factors do not operate‚Äù teaches the method of practice, since one should not open up an opportunity for other mental activities.

original: sems dang sems las byung ba'i rnam par rtog pa rnams mi 'byung bar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyad pa dang mngon par bsgrub pa dang bsgom par bya'o zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: sems dang sems las byung ba'i rnam par rtog pa rnams mi 'byung bar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyad pa dang mngon par bsgrub pa dang bsgom par bya'o zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúOne should practice, accomplish, and cultivate the perfection of wisdom in such a way that the mind and mental factors do not arise‚Äù teaches that one should practice, accomplish, and cultivate the perfection of wisdom without the arising of the conceptual thoughts of mind and mental factors.

original: gsol pa bcom ldan 'das ci 'gas zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyad pa dang / mngon par bsgrub pa dang / bsgom pa rtsol pa dang bcas shing mtshan ma dang bcas pas byas na rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par 'gyur ram zhes zhus pa'o //
analyzed: gsol pa bcom ldan 'das ci 'gas zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyad pa dang / mngon par bsgrub pa dang / bsgom pa rtsol pa dang bcas shing mtshan ma dang bcas pas byas na rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par 'gyur ram zhes zhus pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúBlessed One, is it the case that the knowledge of all aspects is attained by practicing, accomplishing, and cultivating the perfection of wisdom with effort and with signs?‚Äù This is the question.

original: de ni ma yin no zhes bya ba ni rtsol pa dang bcas shing mtshan ma dang bcas pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyad pa dang / mngon par bsgrub pa dang / bsgom pa byas na rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de ni ma yin no zhes bya ba ni rtsol pa dang bcas shing mtshan ma dang bcas pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyad pa dang / mngon par bsgrub pa dang / bsgom pa byas na rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: That is not so means that if one practices, accomplishes, and cultivates the perfection of wisdom with effort and with signs, one will not attain the knowledge of all aspects.

original: 'o na ci lags ma bsgoms pas sam zhes bya ba ni 'o na spyad pa dang mngon par bsgrub pa dang / bsgom pa ma byas pas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par 'gyur ram zhes zhus pa'o //üîΩde ni ma yin no zhes bya ba ni ma spyad cing ma bsgoms pas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob @243a * //
analyzed: 'o na ci lags ma bsgoms pas sam zhes bya ba ni 'o na spyad pa dang mngon par bsgrub pa dang / bsgom pa ma byas pas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par 'gyur ram zhes zhus pa'o // de ni ma yin no zhes bya ba ni ma spyad cing ma bsgoms pas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob @243a * //
translated: Then, is it attained without cultivation? means then is the knowledge of all aspects attained without practice, accomplishment, and cultivation?

original: par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: That is not so means that without practice and cultivation, the knowledge of all aspects is not attained.

original: 'o na ci lags bsgoms kyang bsgoms la ma bsgoms kyang bsgoms sam zhes bya ba ni de ltar bsgoms par mi 'thob /
analyzed: 'o na ci lags bsgoms kyang bsgoms la ma bsgoms kyang bsgoms sam zhes bya ba ni de ltar bsgoms par mi 'thob /
translated: Then, is it attained by cultivation and also by non-cultivation? means thus, it is not attained by cultivation.

original: ma bsgoms par yang mi 'thob na /
analyzed: ma bsgoms par yang mi 'thob na /
translated: If one does not attain it by not cultivating,

original: ci bsgoms pa dang ma bsgoms pa gnyis ka byas pas 'thob bam zhes zhus pa'o //
analyzed: ci bsgoms pa dang ma bsgoms pa gnyis ka byas pas 'thob bam zhes zhus pa'o //
translated: then is it attained by both cultivating and not cultivating?

original: de ni ma yin no zhes bya ba ni gong du smos pa'i skyon gnyi ga ltar 'gyur ba'i phyir de lta yang ma yin no zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: de ni ma yin no zhes bya ba ni gong du smos pa'i skyon gnyi ga ltar 'gyur ba'i phyir de lta yang ma yin no zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: That is not so, because both faults mentioned above would follow.üîΩWell then, is it attained by neither cultivating nor not cultivating?

original: 'o na ci lags bsgoms pa yang ma lags ma bsgoms pa yang ma lags pas sam zhes bya ba ni gcer bu pa'i gzhung las 'byung ba lta bu gnyis ka yang ma yin pa'i dngos po zhig yod de /
analyzed: 'o na ci lags bsgoms pa yang ma lags ma bsgoms pa yang ma lags pas sam zhes bya ba ni gcer bu pa'i gzhung las 'byung ba lta bu gnyis ka yang ma yin pa'i dngos po zhig yod de /
translated: This is like the Jainas, who say that there is a thing that is neither of the two.

original: de lta bus thob bam zhes zhus pa'o //
analyzed: de lta bus thob bam zhes zhus pa'o //
translated: Is it attained in that way?

original: de ni ma yin no zhes bya ba ni de lta yang ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de ni ma yin no zhes bya ba ni de lta yang ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: That is not so, because it is not like that.

original: 'o na rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ji ltar thob par bgyi zhes bya ba ni de bzhin nyid la sogs pa brjod du med cing bsam gyis mi khyab pa de bzhin du rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyang bsgoms par bya ba bstan pa'i skabs
analyzed: 'o na rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ji ltar thob par bgyi zhes bya ba ni de bzhin nyid la sogs pa brjod du med cing bsam gyis mi khyab pa de bzhin du rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyang bsgoms par bya ba bstan pa'i skabs
translated: How is the knowledge of all aspects to be attained?

original: dbye ba'i phyir zhus pa'o //
analyzed: dbye ba'i phyir zhus pa'o //
translated: This is a question about the method for attaining the knowledge of all aspects, since it is asked in terms of the division of the knowledge of all aspects.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One replied:üîΩJust as suchness is.

original: de bzhin nyid ji lta ba bzhin no zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ji ltar 'thob par 'gyur ba'i thabs bstan pa ste /
analyzed: de bzhin nyid ji lta ba bzhin no zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ji ltar 'thob par 'gyur ba'i thabs bstan pa ste /
translated: This and the following passages teach the method for attaining the knowledge of all aspects.
